availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Ambrose Dudley (Lexington Lawyer, Quartermaster General )

body.p: Born on June 9, 1824. Attended Princeton College graduating in 1842. Worked as a Lawyer in Lexington Beginning in 1844. Dudley also worked as the president of the Louisville and Lexington Railway Company beginning in 1850. Dudley was sent as a commissioner to Washington DC with Francis K. Hunt to request the removal of US troops from Kentucky in 1861. On October 3, 1861, Governor Magoffin appointed him Quartermaster General of Kentucky. Dudley died on March 19, 1870.

ab.bibl: Z. F. Smith, The History of Kentucky (Louisville: Courier-Journal Job Printing Company, 1892), 611-612; Find A Grave, "William Ambrose Dudley (June 9, 1824 - March 19, 1870)," Memorial #8872034, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=8872034&ref=acom (accessed June 13, 2017); The Military Department of Kentucky, Military History of Kentucky (Frankfort: The State Journal, 1939), 95. Lexington History Museum, "Lexington and Frankfort Railroad", http://lexhistory.org/wikilex/lexington-frankfort-railroad, (accessed June 13, 2017).
